reflection: "How are You?" we'll ask when we meet on the street."Have a nice day, " we'll say as we move on. He's extending the usual greeting to his ethnically mixed readers just as we use common greetings today. But his words grace and peace are more than just greetings. They are statements of fact for believers. Grace is the quality of God that makes Him eager to give to totally undeserving people the best that He has to offer. In the word's five letters are summed up the forgiveness of sins God has prepared in His Son, the fear-free conscience He gives to those who trust His Son, and the firm hope of heaven waiting for them through His Son. When God's grace showers such gifts on me, peace is the result. Grace and peace go together. God's grace is the cause and wonderful peace is the result for me. Such grace and peace come only "from God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ."
prayer: Dear Lord, through Your Word bring me grace and peace in rich measure. Amen.

reflection: Addition and subtraction are some of the first facts we learn in mathematics. To subtract means to take away. The more you take away the less you have. To add means to increase. The Savior warns me, "Follow the world's math and you will end up with eternal loss." Nothing the world offers can hold a candle to the eternal life Jesus has waiting for me. When the world gets in the way, hate is the right word for my reaction, just as gain is the right word for the life Jesus has waiting for me.
prayer: Dear Lord teach me Your math and help me practice it in life. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. (2 Pet. 3:18)
reflection: "My how you have grown." Remember how embarrassed you felt when some aunt at a family gathering would make that comment? "Yes, " mom would say, "I just can't keep him in jeans." Yes there has come a time when I stopped growing, except around the middle where I don't want it. In one area, though, I'm never done growing. I can never learn to much about the "Knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ." "Knowledge" is my understanding of the Bible's truths. I hadn't learned it all when I finished catechism class. I didn't even understand fully what I had learned. Now as an adult I ask different questions and need fuller answers. I also need to keep growing in "the grace of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ." Grace refers to undeserved gifts from a loving God. What could be more undeserving than His gift of salvation in Jesus? He prepared that gift for an undeserving world. That's salvation in general. He prepared that gift for me. That's salvation in particular. Until my life ends, I need to grow in appreciating His grace. How can I grow? My body does so through regular feeding. So does my soul. I need a steady diet of God's Word if I'm to keep growing in the knowledge and grace of my Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.
prayer: Dear Lord, continue to make me hungry for the saving truths of Your nourishing Word. Amen.
